column4: are there any text editors for gnome that support regular expression find and replace? for that matter is there anything like "flash renamer" (it allows batch renaming of files) for linux? i really can't get my head around bash programming just yet
does that support regex find and replace?
if there are any guides on how to get that working i would be grateful... gedit doesn't seem to do so
but gedit does have a file size limitation
help me out with gedit here : "The text "/\nguff/" was not found."
what are you trying to match is a guff after a newline?
that's right. I don't have any gedit plugins installed either..
it seems every program has a different way of handling regex patterns
and what do you want to replace the match with
I'm not real familiar with regex. when i need to find and replace I generally use sed but to find a match only I would use grep
